noun.description: A small bag or other flexible receptacle, typically carried in a pocket or attached to a belt.
examples: webbing with pouches for stun grenades

noun.description: A pocket-like abdominal receptacle in which marsupials carry their young during lactation.

examples: he stopped, pouched his tickets, and plodded on

verb.description: Make (part of a garment) hang like a pouch.
examples: the muslin is lightly pouched over the belt

origin: Middle English (as a noun): from Old Northern French pouche, variant of Old French poche bag. Compare with poke.
